meanings.definition: A person or thing that brings about harmony or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The team captain acted as a harmonizer, resolving conflicts and uniting everyone.
meanings.sent2: The family therapist served as a harmonizer, helping the members communicate better.
meanings.sent3: The harmonizer in the group always found a way to make everyone see eye to eye.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence was like a harmonizer in the midst of chaos, bringing peace to all.
meanings.sent5: The music conductor was a skilled harmonizer, blending different voices into a beautiful melody.

meanings.definition: A device or software used to combine different musical notes or tones to create a pleasing sound.
meanings.sent1: The musician used a harmonizer to enhance the sound of his guitar during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The studio engineer adjusted the harmonizer settings to achieve the desired vocal effect.
meanings.sent3: The harmonizer gadget made the singer's voice sound like a choir of angels.
meanings.sent4: The harmonizer functioned like a magical wand, transforming ordinary notes into harmonious tunes.
meanings.sent5: With the help of the harmonizer, the band's music resonated with a perfect blend of tones.
